what: Example: Persistence diagram using an Alpha complex
title: An R Interface to GUDHI
code: library(rgudhi) n <- 10 X <- lapply(   seq(0, 2 * pi, len = n),    function(.x) c(cos(.x), sin(.x)) ) ac <- AlphaComplex$new(points = X) st <- ac$create_simplex_tree() st$persistence() #> # A tibble: 14 × 3 #>    dimension birth      death #>        <int> <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1         1 0.117   1.00e+ 0 #>  2         1 1       1.00e+ 0 #>  3         1 1       1   e+ 0 #>  4         1 1       1   e+ 0 #>  5         0 0     Inf        #>  6         0 0       1.17e- 1 #>  7         0 0       1.17e- 1 #>  8         0 0       1.17e- 1 #>  9         0 0       1.17e- 1 #> 10         0 0       1.17e- 1 #> 11         0 0       1.17e- 1 #> 12         0 0       1.17e- 1 #> 13         0 0       1.17e- 1 #> 14         0 0       1.50e-32

code: ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `AlphaComplex$new` ## ------------------------------------------------  n <- 10 Xl <- lapply(   seq(0, 2 * pi, len = n),   function(.x) c(cos(.x), sin(.x)) ) Xm <- Reduce(rbind, Xl, init = numeric()) if (reticulate::py_module_available("gudhi")) {   acm <- AlphaComplex$new(points = Xm)   acl <- AlphaComplex$new(points = Xl)   acl } #> <AlphaComplex> #>   Public: #>     clone: function (deep = FALSE)  #>     create_simplex_tree: function (max_alpha_square = Inf, default_filtration_value = FALSE)  #>     get_point: function (vertex)  #>     initialize: function (points, precision = "safe")  #>   Private: #>     m_ComputedSimplexTree: FALSE #>     m_PythonClass: gudhi.alpha_complex.AlphaComplex, python.builtin.object  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `AlphaComplex$create_simplex_tree` ## ------------------------------------------------  n <- 10 X <- lapply(   seq(0, 2 * pi, len = n),   function(.x) c(cos(.x), sin(.x)) ) if (reticulate::py_module_available("gudhi")) {   ac <- AlphaComplex$new(points = X)   st <- ac$create_simplex_tree() }  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `AlphaComplex$get_point` ## ------------------------------------------------  n <- 10 X <- lapply(   seq(0, 2 * pi, len = n),   function(.x) c(cos(.x), sin(.x)) ) if (reticulate::py_module_available("gudhi")) {   ac <- AlphaComplex$new(points = X)   st <- ac$create_simplex_tree()   ac$get_point(1) } #> [1] 0.7660444 0.6427876

what: R6 Class for Cover Complex — CoverComplex
title: R6 Class for Cover Complex — CoverComplex
text: Nerves Graph Induced Complexes cover complexes, .e. simplicial complexes provably contain topological information input data. can computed cover data, comes .e. pre-image family intervals covering image scalar-valued function defined data.

title: R6 Class for Cover Complex — CoverComplex
text: Cover complex data structure. data structure simplicial complex, representing Graph Induced simplicial Complex (GIC) Nerve, whose simplices computed cover \(C\) point cloud \(P\), often comes pre-images intervals covering image function \(f\) defined \(P\). intervals parameterised resolution (either length number) gain (percentage overlap). compute GIC, one also needs graph \(G\) built top \(P\), whose cliques vertices belonging different elements \(C\) correspond simplices GIC.

title: R6 Class for Cover Complex — CoverComplex
text: Mathieu Carrière

code: ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `WitnessComplex$new` ## ------------------------------------------------  withr::with_seed(1234, {   l <- list(     tibble::tibble(       nearest_landmark = sample.int(10),       distance = sort(rexp(10))     ),     tibble::tibble(       nearest_landmark = sample.int(10),       distance = sort(rexp(10))     )   ) }) if (reticulate::py_module_available("gudhi")) {   wc <- WitnessComplex$new(nearest_landmark_table = l)   wc } #> <WitnessComplex> #>   Public: #>     clone: function (deep = FALSE)  #>     create_simplex_tree: function (max_alpha_square = Inf)  #>     initialize: function (nearest_landmark_table)  #>   Private: #>     m_ComputedSimplexTree: FALSE #>     m_PythonClass: gudhi.witness_complex.WitnessComplex, python.builtin.object  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `WitnessComplex$create_simplex_tree` ## ------------------------------------------------  withr::with_seed(1234, {   l <- list(     tibble::tibble(       nearest_landmark = sample.int(10),       distance = sort(rexp(10))     ),     tibble::tibble(       nearest_landmark = sample.int(10),       distance = sort(rexp(10))     )   ) }) if (reticulate::py_module_available("gudhi")) {   wc <- WitnessComplex$new(nearest_landmark_table = l)   st <- wc$create_simplex_tree()   st$num_vertices() } #> [1] 10
